intro: Calophyllum neoebudicum, commonly known as the Neobudic wood or Neobudic tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Calophyllaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The tree produces woody, orange-colored fruits that contain several seeds. It is valued for its durable timber and is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat-specific requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
